Black Widow Books was once owned by the wealthy businessman, Victor Lockwood. Tragically, he met an untimely end in a suspicious accident. His young and beautiful widow, Amber Lockwood, inherited everything and chose to keep the bookstore alive. 
The shop's name, as morbidly romantic as it sounds, was coined by the locals, who whispered about how the widow had claimed yet another life. Despite the rumors, Amber has become a staple of the community for her extensive collection of rare and macabre literature.
